name: caryopsis
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
a small fruit that contains a single seed that is joined as one with the fruit, for example the grains found in rice, corn, and wheat: Each kernel on an ear of corn is a caryopsis, where the seed is fused to the wall of the ovary that contains it. The agriculture students learned about the cultivation of feed plants by studying the caryopses of barley and wheat.
More examplesFewer examplesIn grains that contain caryopses, the fruit and the seed are essentially the same.
